ARABIC: وَيَٰقَوْمِ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ يَوْمَ ٱلتَّنَادِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: My people! I fear for you the Day of Calling Out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: O my people, what I fear for you is the day of gathering, crying and calling,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: My people, I fear that you will encounter a day when there will be much wailing and you will cry out to one another for help,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: My people, I am afraid for you on (the Day of Judgment), when people will cry for help.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “O my people! I fear for you a day on which will be a great outcry!”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And, O my people! Verily, I fear for you the Day when there will be mutual calling."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And, O my people! I fear for you the day of calling out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Invocation,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And, O my people! Lo! I fear for you a Day of Summoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: My people, I fear for you the Day you will cry out to one another,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And, O my people! verily fear for you a Day of Mutual Calling.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O my people! I fear for you a day of mutual distress calls,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And O my people! I fear for you a Day when there will be Mutual calling (and wailing),-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And, O my people! Verily! I fear for you the Day when there will be mutual calling (between the people of Hell and of Paradise)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And, my nation, I fear for you the Day of Calling,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: O my people, I fear for you the Day of Calling Out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And O my people, indeed I fear for you the Day of Calling -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [40:32] And O my people! Truly I fear for you a day of [mutual] calling (read yawma’l-tanādi, omitting the [final long] yā’, or retaining it thus: yawma’l-tanādī) that is to say, the Day of Resurrection, in which repeated calls are made by those meriting Paradise to those meriting the Fire and vice versa, as well as calls [proclaiming] good fortune for those who merit the former and misery for those who merit the latter and [many] other such [calls],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And, O my people! Lo! I fear for) I know that you will suffer the torment of (a Day of Summoning) when you will call one another and when the people of the Heights will call you; and it is also said this is the Day when people will flee from each other,
